lnx_dd_delete_file.name: Overwriting the File with Dev Zero or Null
lnx_dd_delete_file.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: Jakob Weinzettl, oscd.community

additional_context.title: Overwriting the File with Dev Zero or Null

aws_ec2_startup_script_change.name: AWS EC2 Startup Shell Script Change
aws_ec2_startup_script_change.description: Detects changes to the EC2 instance startup script. The shell script will be executed as root/SYSTEM everytime the specific instances are booted up.
aws_ec2_startup_script_change.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: faloker
aws_ec2_startup_script_change.knownFP: Valid changes to the startup script

additional_context.title: AWS EC2 Startup Shell Script Change
additional_context.detail: Detects changes to the EC2 instance startup script. The shell script will be executed as root/SYSTEM everytime the specific instances are booted up.

aws_ec2_download_userdata.name: AWS EC2 Download Userdata
aws_ec2_download_userdata.description: Detects bulk downloading of User Data associated with AWS EC2 instances. Instance User Data may include installation scripts and hard-coded secrets for deployment.
aws_ec2_download_userdata.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: faloker

additional_context.search: (eventSource="ec2.amazonaws.com" requestParameters.attribute="userData" eventName="DescribeInstanceAttribute") | eventstats count as val | search val > 10
additional_context.title: AWS EC2 Download Userdata
additional_context.detail: Detects bulk downloading of User Data associated with AWS EC2 instances. Instance User Data may include installation scripts and hard-coded secrets for deployment.

aws_rds_public_db_restore.name: Restore Public AWS RDS Instance
aws_rds_public_db_restore.description: Detects the recovery of a new public database instance from a snapshot. It may be a part of data exfiltration.
aws_rds_public_db_restore.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: faloker

additional_context.title: Restore Public AWS RDS Instance
additional_context.detail: Detects the recovery of a new public database instance from a snapshot. It may be a part of data exfiltration.

aws_iam_backdoor_users_keys.name: AWS IAM Backdoor Users Keys
aws_iam_backdoor_users_keys.description: Detects AWS API key creation for a user by another user. Backdoored users can be used to obtain persistence in the AWS environment. Also with this alert, you can detect a flow of AWS keys in your org.
aws_iam_backdoor_users_keys.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: faloker
aws_iam_backdoor_users_keys.knownFP: Adding user keys to their own accounts (the filter cannot cover all possible variants of user naming)

additional_context.title: AWS IAM Backdoor Users Keys
additional_context.detail: Detects AWS API key creation for a user by another user. Backdoored users can be used to obtain persistence in the AWS environment. Also with this alert, you can detect a flow of AWS keys in your org.

aws_rds_change_master_password.name: AWS RDS Master Password Change
aws_rds_change_master_password.description: Detects the change of database master password. It may be a part of data exfiltration.
aws_rds_change_master_password.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.

aws_rds_change_master_password.knownFP: Benign changes to a db instance

aws_guardduty_disruption.name: AWS GuardDuty Important Change
aws_guardduty_disruption.description: Detects updates of the GuardDuty list of trusted IPs, perhaps to disable security alerts against malicious IPs.
aws_guardduty_disruption.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: faloker
aws_guardduty_disruption.knownFP: Valid change in the GuardDuty (e.g. to ignore internal scanners)

additional_context.title: AWS GuardDuty Important Change
additional_context.detail: Detects updates of the GuardDuty list of trusted IPs, perhaps to disable security alerts against malicious IPs.

lnx_shell_clear_cmd_history.name: Clear Command History
lnx_shell_clear_cmd_history.description: Clear command history in linux which is used for defense evasion.
lnx_shell_clear_cmd_history.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: Patrick Bareiss

additional_context.search: ("rm *bash_history" OR "echo \"\" > *bash_history" OR "cat /dev/null > *bash_history" OR "ln -sf /dev/null *bash_history" OR "truncate -s0 *bash_history" OR "export HISTFILESIZE=0" OR "history -c" OR "history -w" OR "shred *bash_history")
additional_context.title: Clear Command History
additional_context.detail: Clear command history in linux which is used for defense evasion.

lnx_susp_ssh.name: Suspicious SSHD Error
lnx_susp_ssh.description: Detects suspicious SSH / SSHD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts
lnx_susp_ssh.company_description:
Sigma is a generic and open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straight forward manner. The rule format is very flexible, easy to write and applicable to any type of log file. The main purpose of this project is to provide a structured form in which researchers or analysts can describe their once developed detection methods and make them shareable with others.
 Author: Florian Roth

additional_context.search: ("*unexpected internal error*" OR "*unknown or unsupported key type*" OR "*invalid certificate signing key*" OR "*invalid elliptic curve value*" OR "*incorrect signature*" OR "*error in libcrypto*" OR "*unexpected bytes remain after decoding*" OR "*fatal: buffer_get_string: bad string*" OR "*Local: crc32 compensation attack*" OR "*bad client public DH value*" OR "*Corrupted MAC on input*")
additional_context.title: Suspicious SSHD Error
additional_context.detail: Detects suspicious SSH / SSHD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts
